location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Bushire, to Sir Bartle Frere

physicalDescription.extent: The main body of the letter covers folios twenty-seven through twenty-nine. The postscript to the letter commences on the lower part of the recto of folio thirty and continues over on the verso.

mods.abstract: Letter regarding Caromandel's route back to India and informing Frere that it will also tow the Georgianato Kurachee [Karachi], as well as Pelly's arrangements with regards to Bereniceand the detachment of marines stationed at Mussundom [Musandam].The letter also discusses the assistants that are being sent to Bushire; what Captain Henry W Warner and Mr Edwin Dawes rolls should be; the spcimens which pelly has sent to Sir Roderick Murchison; and the portraits of Persepolis for James Ferguson.The letter also makes reference to Pelly's interest in the songs of Persia.
